org.hps.monitoring.subsys

Interface SystemStatus

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SystemStatusImpl

    public interface SystemStatus
    The SystemStatus describes the state of a system, e.g. whether it is okay or some level of error has occurred. Listeners can be registered on these objects, which will be notified whenever the status changes, in order to update a GUI component, trip an alarm, etc. There is one SystemStatus object for each quantity to be monitored on a sub-system. New objects are not created when the status changes. Instead, the StatusCode is changed with a custom message describing the new state. Listeners are updated whenever the status is changed. It is up to the notified object to determine what to do when the state changes.

      Add a listener to receive notification when the status changes.

      Set whether this status is active.
      void setStatus(StatusCode code, String message)
      Set the current status code and message, which will cause the last changed time to be set and the listeners to be notified of the status change.

    • Method Detail

      • getSubsystem

        Subsystem getSubsystem()
        Get the sub-system e.g. "SVT".
        Returns:
        The assigned sub-system.

      • getStatusCode

        StatusCode getStatusCode()
        Get the current status code.
        Returns:
        The current status code.

      • getDescription

        String getDescription()
        Get the description of the system status. This is used to differentiate multiple monitoring points on the same sub-system so it could be something like "SVT occupancy rates".
        Returns:
        The description of the system status.

      • getMessage

        String getMessage()
        Get the current message.
        Returns:
        The current message

      • setStatus

        void setStatus(StatusCode code,
               String message)
        Set the current status code and message, which will cause the last changed time to be set and the listeners to be notified of the status change.
        Parameters:
        code - The new status code.

      • getLastChangedMillis

        long getLastChangedMillis()
        Get the time when the system status last changed.
        Returns:
        The time when the system status changed.

      • addListener

        void addListener(SystemStatusListener listener)
        Add a listener to receive notification when the status changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener object.

      • setActive

        void setActive(boolean active)
        Set whether this status is active. Inactive statuses will not be updated in the GUI. This can be changed "on the fly" in the system status panel. Listeners will NOT be notified of state changes when active is False.

      • isActive

        boolean isActive()
        True if the status is active.
        Returns:
        True if status is active.

      • isClearable

        boolean isClearable()
        True if the status can be cleared.
        Returns:
        True if status can be cleared.
